overview.intro: third year cs student at ubc. incoming software engineering intern at microsoft. previously a software engineer intern at planview working on copilot/ anvi. learn more
overview.interests: interested in applied AI/ML, backend engineering, data engineering, distributed systems, and infra.
overview.hobbiesIntro: also into f1, english football, sports cars, video editing, mechanical keyboards, games and more. learn more
overview.closing: . always down for a good chat so feel free to connect. thanks for visiting, talk soon!

description: joining microsoft teams as a software engineering intern in the summer, focusing on backend services and distributed systems infrastructure

experiences.overview: full stack engineering alongside a team of 7 for copilot/ anvi, an integrated multi-agent ai assistant and automation platform embedded into planview's work management software suite
description: led e2e development of 'workflows', a multi-step action and workflow automation framework for all planview apps provided through copilot, with an implementation focus on the backend asynchronous execution engine, API, and agentic email client
led e2e development of prompt and workflow template library, increasing user adoption of saved prompts and workflows
designed mcp server integration registry for hybrid tool calling client, increasing quality and accuracy of answers while maintaining backwards compatibility with non-mcp tools
developed system prompt injection pipeline api for response personalization, increasing per-user customizability
developed e2e follow up prompt generation pipeline, increasing per-session user interactions and overall retention

led migration of unobfuscated logs to independent secure logging pipeline pushed to cloudwatch via fluent bit daemonset to remain compliant with data retention policy while maintaining full observability

experiences.overview: ta for cpsc 110, ubc's intro course to computer science through functional programming
description: led labs for 600+ total cpsc 110 students
held office hours to support students in their understanding of algorithms and data structures
given an overall 90% favorable rating by students on the metrics of helpfulness and clear communication

items.description: i've been hooked on topre switches for quite some time. i primarily use an hhkb professional hybrid type-s. it took a while for me to get used to the layout. i also have a realforce r3s i got in japan - this was my first topre board. i have a few other custom boards with cherry style switches, both soldered and hot-swappable, some made of plastic, some made of lego :D

don't play as many video games anymore because of priorities and time constraints. was recently gifted a 3ds xl, currently playing mario kart 7 (ctgp7), pokemon usum with plans to play a few more games. also still play a bit of overwatch and valorant on occasion. previously played a lot of fortnite, gta, f1, fifa/fc, minecraft, need for speed, fall guys.

recently got back into tcg. collection isn't great but i have a few cool cards worth a bit of money. i got an xy evolutions booster box for my 12th birthday (worth ~3k now). my favorite pokemon is ditto. also used to play a lot of pokemon go.
i hope to own and maintain a clean nb or nc miata in the near future. currently drive a family-shared 2020 prius prime.

i sew to make my clothes fit the way i want them to. 80-90% of the clothes i wear are altered in some way by me because clothes usually don't fit me exactly the way i want off the rack. i use my mom's brother cs6000i. it's good enough for what i do.
i've had a mini-itx build since i first got into pcs. currently running a 5600x and a 3070 with a case volume of 9L.
vegas pro user since 2018. made montages, school projects, short-form videos, and more.
have been playing for 15+ years, 3 of those in vyso. a lot more on and off now because of school, work, life.

i ski. used to go to grouse every year as a kid. first run back in 2026 since 2020. i had fun. thinking about getting a season pass for 2027. hopefully the season will be long enough for the pass to be worth it.
i love the cross section of engineering, sport, and speed. unfortunately, i support ferrari.
i primarily follow the premier league and european football, though i also keep up with international games and the mls. i support liverpool.
